intro: Boerhavia rottleri, commonly known as the dwarf velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, giving it a velvety appearance. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, clustered in small groups at the leaf axils. Boerhavia rottleri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
